intro: Cyrtandra kalaeensis, commonly known as the Kāneʻohe plant, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and streamside habitats. Its leaves are usually elliptical and have a smooth texture, while its stems are often covered in a fine, white pubescence. Cyrtandra kalaeensis is considered an important species in Hawaiian botanical studies due to its unique adaptations and limited distribution.
